com.topcoder.clients.dao.ejb3
Class GenericEJB3DAO<T extends com.topcoder.clients.model.AuditableEntity,Id extends java.io.Serializable>

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.clients.dao.ejb3.GenericEJB3DAO<T,Id>
Type Parameters:
T - The entity type to operate
Id - The type of id of entity
All Implemented Interfaces:
GenericDAO<T,Id>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientDAOBean, ClientStatusDAOBean, CompanyDAOBean, ProjectDAOBean, ProjectStatusDAOBean
public abstract class GenericEJB3DAO<T extends com.topcoder.clients.model.AuditableEntity,Id extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements GenericDAO<T,Id>

This abstract class represents the base GenericEJB3DAO class.

This base class implements the generic methods available for all the concrete DAOs: retrieve entity by id, retrieve all entities, search entities by name, search entities using the given filter, save an given entity, delete an given entity.

It is configured with an EntityManager (initialized by the EJB container through dependency injection) needed to perform operations on the persistence and also uses TopCoder Search Builder 1.4 component to perform the search using the given Filter.

NOTE: it is not an Stateless session bean.

sample usage of EJBs: 

 // retrieve bean
 InitialContext ctx = new InitialContext();
 ProjectDAORemote bean = (ProjectDAORemote) ctx
         .lookup("client_project_entities_dao/ProjectDAOBean/remote");
 
 Filter filter = new EqualToFilter("projectStatus", project.getProjectStatus()
         .getId());
 
 List<Project> projects;
 
 // get project for corresponding id
 Project tempProject = bean.retrieveById(100L);
 
 // get all projects
 projects = bean.retrieveAll();
 
 // get all projects with the name "name"
 projects = bean.searchByName("name");
 
 // get all that match the given filter
 projects = bean.search(filter);
 
 // save or update a project
 bean.save(project);
 
 // delete the project
 bean.delete(project);
 
 // get project for corresponding id without projectChildren
 tempProject = bean.retrieveById(100L, false);
 
 // get project for corresponding id with projectChildren
 tempProject = bean.retrieveById(100L, true);
 
 // get all projects without projectChildrens
 projects = bean.retrieveAll(false);
 
 // get all projects with projectChildrens
 projects = bean.retrieveAll(true);

THREAD SAFETY: Implementations of this interface should be thread safe.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mafy, TCSDEVELOPER

Method Detail

initialize

@PostConstruct
protected void initialize()

Initialize the searchByFilterUtility and makes sure the initialization of this session bean is ok.

This method is called after this bean is constructed by the EJB container.

Throws:
DAOConfigurationException - if the String fields are null or empty, if needed configurations are missing or entityManager is invalid (invalid means null here), if Object Factory cannot be initialized or cannot create SearchByFilterUtility specific object.

public T retrieveById(Id id)
                                                                  throws EntityNotFoundException,
                                                                         DAOException
Performs the retrieval of an entity using the given id from the persistence. Return null if the entity is deleted.

Specified by:
retrieveById in interface GenericDAO<T extends com.topcoder.clients.model.AuditableEntity,Id extends java.io.Serializable>
Parameters:
id - the identifier of the entity that should be retrieved. Should be positive and not null.
Returns:
the entity with the given id retrieved from the persistence.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if id <= 0 or id is null.
EntityNotFoundException - if an entity for the given id is not found in the persistence.
DAOConfigurationException - if the configured entityManager is invalid (invalid means null here).
DAOException - if any error occurs while performing this operation.
